column2: The strategy sets targets for an installed capacity of at least 60 GW of offshore wind by 2030 and 300 GW by 2050
column5: The implementation of TA2.38 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.23, as the increased production of offshore wind energy will lead to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions, which in turn will contribute to the reduction of waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: The strategy sets targets for an installed capacity of at least 1 GW of ocean energy by 2030 and 40 GW by 2050
column5: The implementation of TA2.39 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.23, as the increased production of ocean energy will lead to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions, which in turn will contribute to the reduction of waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Around 30% of EU primary steel production is expected to be decarbonised on the basis of renewable hydrogen.
column5: The implementation of TA2.40 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.18, as the increased use of renewable hydrogen in steel production will lead to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions and an increase in the recycling of materials.

column2: Halve the amount of residual (non-recycled) municipal waste by 2030
column5: The implementation of TA3.1 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.23, as the reduction of municipal waste will contribute to the achievement of a circular economy and the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Double EU’s circular material use rate in the coming decade
column5: The implementation of TA3.3 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.23, as the increase in circular material use will contribute to the reduction of waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: By 2030, Union extraction capacity should be able to extract the ores, minerals or concentrates needed to produce at least 10% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: The implementation of TA3.8 may have a negative impact on TA3.23, as the increased extraction of raw materials may lead to environmental degradation and an increase in greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: By 2030, Union processing capacity, including for all intermediate processing steps, should be able of producing at least 40% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: The implementation of TA3.9 may have a negative impact on TA3.23, as the increased processing of raw materials may lead to environmental degradation and an increase in greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Diversify the Union’s imports of strategic raw materials with a view to ensuring that, by 2030, the Union’s annual consumption of each strategic raw material at any relevant stage of processing can rely on imports from several third countries or from overseas countries or territories
column5: The implementation of TA3.11 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.23, as the diversification of imports will contribute to the reduction of dependence on a single supplier and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: By 2030, manufacturing capacity in the Union of the strategic net-zero technologies listed in the Annex approaches or reaches a benchmark of at least 40% of the Union’s annual deployment needs
column5: The implementation of TA3.12 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.23, as the increase in manufacturing capacity will contribute to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: By 2030, Union recycling capacity, including for all intermediate recycling steps, should be able of producing at least 25% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: The implementation of TA3.13 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.23, as the increase in recycling capacity will contribute to the reduction of waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Producers of starting, lighting and ignition batteries, industrial batteries and electric vehicle batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall take back, free of charge and without an obligation on the end-user to buy a new battery
column5: The implementation of TA3.15 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.23, as the increased recycling of batteries will contribute to the reduction of waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Producers of portable batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets for waste portable batteries
column5: The implementation of TA3.16 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.23, as the increased collection of portable batteries will contribute to the reduction of waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Producers of LMT batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets of waste LMT batteries
column5: The implementation of TA3.17 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.23, as the increased collection of LMT batteries will contribute to the reduction of waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: For industrial batteries with a capacity greater than 2kWh, except those with exclusively external storage, electric vehicle batteries and starting, lighting and ignition batteries that contain cobalt, lead, lithium or nickel in active materials, the minimum recycled content percentage for each battery model per year and per manufacturing plant shall be
column5: The implementation of TA3.18 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.23, as the increased recycling of materials will contribute to the reduction of waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Any natural or legal person that places on the market products incorporating portable batteries shall ensure that those batteries are readily removable and replaceable by the end-user at any time during the lifetime of the product
column5: The implementation of TA3.19 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.23, as the increased design for recyclability will contribute to the reduction of waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency
column5: The implementation of TA3.20 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.23, as the increased recycling efficiency will contribute to the reduction of waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency
column5: The implementation of TA3.21 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.23, as the increased recycling efficiency will contribute to the reduction of waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials
column5: The implementation of TA3.22 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.23, as the increased recovery of materials will contribute to the reduction of waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials, 50% for lithium, no later than 31 December 2027
column5: The implementation of TA3.23 may have a negative impact on TA2.38, as the increased focus on recycling and recovery of materials may lead to a decrease in the production of new renewable energy technologies, such as offshore wind.

column2: Reduce the generation of food waste in processing and manufacturing by 10% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
column5: The implementation of TA3.24 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the reduction of food waste will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Reduce the generation of food waste per capita, jointly in retail and other distribution of food, in restaurants and food services and in households, by 30% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
column5: The implementation of TA3.25 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the reduction of food waste will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: All packaging shall be recyclable
column5: The implementation of TA3.27 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the increased recyclability of packaging will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: The plastic part in packaging shall contain the following minimum percentage of recycled content recovered from post-consumer plastic waste
column5: The implementation of TA3.28 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the increased use of recycled content in packaging will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Member States shall take measures to achieve a sustained reduction in the consumption of lightweight plastic carrier bags on their territory
column5: The implementation of TA3.29 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the reduction of plastic carrier bags will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Each Member State shall reduce the packaging waste generated per capita, as compared to the packaging waste generated per capita in 2018 as reported to the Commission in accordance with Decision 2005/270/EC
column5: The implementation of TA3.30 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the reduction of packaging waste will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain the recycling targets of 65% by weight of all packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
column5: The implementation of TA3.31 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the increased recycling of packaging waste will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 50% of plastic by weight of plastic contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
column5: The implementation of TA3.32 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the increased recycling of plastic packaging waste will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 25% of wood by weight of wood contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
column5: The implementation of TA3.33 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the increased recycling of wood packaging waste will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 70% of ferrous metals by weight of ferrous metals contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
column5: The implementation of TA3.34 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the increased recycling of ferrous metals packaging waste will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 50% of aluminium by weight of aluminium contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
column5: The implementation of TA3.35 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the increased recycling of aluminium packaging waste will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 70% of glass by weight of glass contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
column5: The implementation of TA3.36 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the increased recycling of glass packaging waste will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 75% of paper and cardboard by weight of paper and cardboard contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
column5: The implementation of TA3.37 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the increased recycling of paper and cardboard packaging waste will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Each vehicle belonging to a vehicle type that is type-approved as of [the first day of the month following 72 months after the date of entry into force of this Regulation] under Regulation (EU) 2018/858 shall be constructed so that it is reusable/recyclable to a minimum of 85% by mass
column5: The implementation of TA3.38 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the increased recyclability of vehicles will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: The plastic contained in each vehicle type that is type-approved as of [the first day of the month following 72 months after the date of entry into force of the Regulation] under Regulation (EU) 2018/858 shall contain a minimum of 25% of plastic recycled by weight from post-consumer plastic waste
column5: The implementation of TA3.48 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the increased use of recycled plastic in vehicles will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: At least 25% of the target set out in the first subparagraph shall be achieved by including plastics recycled from end-of-life vehicles in the vehicle type concerned
column5: The implementation of TA3.49 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the increased recycling of plastics from end-of-life vehicles will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.

column2: Member States shall ensure that the following targets are met by the waste management operators
column5: The implementation of TA3.50 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.1, as the increased recycling and reuse of waste will contribute to the reduction of municipal waste and the achievement of a circular economy.
